body_html:
Odd, obviously it's creating the files, it's just not finding them for some reason. Can you check for permission issues, e.g.:
find bazel-*/ | grep libtensorflow_demo.so$ | xargs ls -la ?

The only command you should run with sudo is the one to install bazel, that should put it in /usr/bin. e.g. sudo ./bazel-0.2.1-installer-linux-x86_64.sh. I'd try installing it that way and see if it gets you anywhere.

find bazel-*/ | grep libtensorflow_demo.so$ | xargs ls -la ?
The only command you should run with sudo is the one to install bazel, that should put it in /usr/bin. e.g. sudo ./bazel-0.2.1-installer-linux-x86_64.sh. I'd try installing it that way and see if it gets you anywhere.
body:
Odd, obviously it's creating the files, it's just not finding them for some reason. Can you check for permission issues, e.g.:
`find bazel-*/ | grep libtensorflow_demo.so$ | xargs ls -la` ?

The only command you should run with sudo is the one to install bazel, that should put it in /usr/bin. e.g. `sudo ./bazel-0.2.1-installer-linux-x86_64.sh`. I'd try installing it that way and see if it gets you anywhere.
